definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: Who cleanses away her sin burdened for several ages?
sentences.chinese: 又是谁，涤荡了背负几世的罪。

sentences.english: The truck kicked a cloud of dust up.
sentences.chinese: 阵雨涤荡了空中飞扬的灰尘。

sentences.english: Would gush, flush, green these mountains and these valleys.
sentences.chinese: 将奋力喷出，冲刷涤荡，灌绿青山和这些山谷。

sentences.english: The Melody of Happiness has been played on their course of growth.
sentences.chinese: 快乐分享的主旋律，涤荡在他们终将难忘的成长之路。
阵雨涤荡了空中飞扬的灰尘。

sentences.english: The preacher asked God to forgive us our sins and wash away our iniquities .
sentences.chinese: 牧师乞求上帝赦免我们的罪过，涤荡我们的罪孽。

sentences.english: Or because ablution washes away the past?
sentences.chinese: 抑或清洗能将以前的罪过涤荡一空？

sentences.english: When peace is active sweeping its dirt, it is storm.
sentences.chinese: 当和风兴奋地涤荡污垢时，它就是风暴。

definition: to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
